briefTitle: The Effectiveness of SMS in Improving Antiretroviral Medication Adherence Among Adolescents Living With HIV in Nigeria
officialTitle: A Single-blind, Randomized, Parallel Design Study to Assess the Effectiveness of SMS Reminders in Improving ART Adherence Among Adolescents Living With HIV in Nigeria (STARTA Trial-Adolescents)

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan, and Informed Consent Form

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* HIV seropositivity
* Being on ART for at least three month
* Age 15 to 19 years as at last birthday
* Use of personal mobile phone
* Poor adherence to ART

Exclusion Criteria:

Adolescents who are too ill to require hospital admission will be excluded from the study.

primary.measure: ART Adherence at 20 Weeks as Determined by VAS, Viral Load
primary.description:
ART adherence is assessed by different well-validated methods. In this study, ART adherence will be measured, primarily, using the self-report visual analog scale. The scale is well-validated, self-report of the level of ART adherence with a range from 0 to 100%. While higher values indicate better levels of adherence, patients with adherence levels of 95% and above are regarded as ART-adherent while those with values less than 95% are not adherent to ART medications.

Viral load is the number of copies of viral RNA detected in participants' blood. Participants with viral load \</=20 copies per ml are regarded to have optimal viral suppression indicative of optimal adherence to medications.

primary.measure: ART Adherence at 20 Weeks as Determined by Pill Counts, ACTG Adherence Questionnaire, and VAS Scores
primary.description:
AIDS Clinical Trials Group Scale scores range from 0 to 1. The higher scores reflect better ART adherence Pill count scores also range from 0 to 1 and the higher scores also reflect better adherence.

Visual analog scale \[VAS\] adherence ranges between 0 and 100%. Higher scores reflect better ART adherence

primary.measure: ART Adherence at 20 Weeks as Determined by Viral Load Count
primary.description: Viral load count is measured in copies per ml. The minimum value is 0. There is no maximum value. The higher values reflect poor adherence

primary.measure: ART Adherence at 20 Weeks as Determined by Log of Viral Load Count
primary.description: log of viral load count is log 10 transformation of the viral load values

secondary.description: Patient satisfaction will be assessed using a 22-item adaptation of the SERVQUAL tool. It is a multi-dimensional service quality assessment tool that uses a 5-point likert scale scored from 1 to 5 points to assess 5 domains of client satisfaction. The domains are tangibility (4 items; scores from 4 to 20), reliability (5 items; scores from 5 to 25), responsiveness (4 items; scores from 4 to 20), assurance (4 items; scores from 4 to 20), and empathy (5 items; scores from 5 to 25). Patient satisfaction is measured by the total score which will range between 22 and 110. Higher scores indicate better client satisfaction.

secondary.measure: Number of Participants With Mental Distress Determined by General Health Questionnaire 12 at 20 Weeks
secondary.description: The General Health Questionnaire 12 (GHQ12) will be used to assess the mental health status of all the participants. It is a well-validated and widely used instrument for screening for mental health distress. It is a 12-item questionnaire that is based on a 4-point likert scale scored from 0 to 3 points. The scores will range between 0 and 36. A score of 12 or more is suggestive of mental distress while scores less than 12 suggest that mental distress is absent.
